Posts.Content: First of all don't worry. See your gyno on Tues, have him/her check it, and give you a script for a mammo. Don't worry about the mammo, it's not any big deal. They don't hurt, maybe just feel a little uncomfortable for a minute. To me, a mammo is easier than a pap smear....LOL next step if it shows up on the mammo, would be an ultrasound. Very painless! It's a breeze! I've just had a mammo that found a lump, and an ultrasound and they told me it's a benign cyst. I have fibrocystic breasts, which means they have a lot of lumps, but they're not bad lumps. Maybe you have the same thing. What I'm trying to say is just follow up on it, go thru the tests, and hopefully it won't be anything to worry about and you can put your mind to rest. Even if it is something, you found it early, can get it out, and go on to LIVE your life! Don't worry! You're doing the right thing! It will be ok!
Posts.Title: new lump, scared, suggestions please...

Posts.Content: don't worry......I get called back a lot because I have "fibrocyctic breasts" that just means they are lumpy naturally......usually it's a cyst. They will probably want to do an ultrasound and another mammogram. Don't sweat it, it's better to be safe
Posts.Title: First mammogram.

Posts.Content: great news! I was going to say, it's probably a cyst because I have one that comes and goes and it gets tender if it's pressed just the right way! I'm glad you got it checked so you can put your mind at ease!
Posts.Title: Painful lump

Posts.Content: it may be a cyst.....cysts come and go depending on your cycle. an ultrasound should be able to determine if it is a cyst cysts are basically harmless.
Posts.Title: Ignored Lump

Posts.Content: well that letter was reassurring! yes it would have been nice to get that before the phone call yeah timing is everything....LOL I might reschedule it for the following week so you know you're in the first two weeks, as opposed to being on the tail end of your cycle. I don't know if it makes that much difference in the US, but it might. Cysts change during your monthly cycle, they come and go. I'm sure everything will be fine. keep us posted
Posts.Title: Dense Breast Tissue?

Posts.Content: i've read that for maximum accuracy you should schedule a mammogram within the first 2 weeks of your period....counting day one as the day you start your period....so it could be the week of your period, and the week after to be safe.... i have dense fibrocystic breasts and usually get called back everytime for an US and they always say it was just a cyst...... don't worry!
Posts.Title: Dense Breast Tissue?

Posts.Content: I'm guessing the word is adenoma, which I think means tumor. Hopefully it's a cyst. I have cysts that come and go and when I get a mammogram, I usually have to come back for an ultrasound and then they tell me don't worry it's a cyst. Don't worry ahead of time, it's probably a cyst, but it's good that you're checking it out!
Posts.Title: Breast Lump, Mass

Posts.Content: yes I have fibrocystic breasts..... fun stuff....huh? sometimes I get tenderness that comes and goes, but I think it may have to do with different things, such as how much caffeine you're consuming, etc.
Posts.Title: fibrocystic changes

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply! I'm going next Fri, the 23rd. If they don't see anything this time, do I still need to get a biopsy or talk to a surgeon? I'm hoping it will be like before, I had to do this and when I did, they didn't see anything and that was the end of it. That was a few years ago. They said it was probably just a cyst that comes and goes.
Posts.Title: 10 mm nodule in breast

Posts.Content: yeah!!! my Dr called today and said it's a benign cyst and to have another mammo in 6 months!!!!!!!!! yeah!!
Posts.Title: 10 mm nodule in breast

Posts.Content: The results of my mammo are in and they said I have a 10 mm nodule. I'm going back in 2 weeks for a diagnostic mammo, and an ultrasound. I have fibrocyctic breasts, so I'm thinking maybe it's just a cyst and nothing to worry about... my mom had breast cancer at age 65, had a lumpectomy and they got it all. No chemo, radioation or anything. I'm 45. Anyone have any ideas? or anyone have the same thing?
Posts.Title: 10 mm nodule in breast
